cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi NNE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest, cross the Yucatán Peninsula Saturday night, then move north-northwest across the central Gulf with a probable approach to the TX/LA coastline late Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (near Lake Charles-Cameron area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for portions of the Nicaragua/Honduras coast, Bay Islands and Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward to Alabama is within the day-4/5 cone
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤18%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusts could briefly reach 35–40 mph late Tuesday if the center tracks west of guidance.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge indicated for the upper Texas coast with current track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 1–3 inches Tuesday night into Wednesday; totals above 4 inches are not currently expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None identified beyond routine squalls and elevated seas in the approaches to Sabine Pass.
